title: true story

description.plain:
“true story” details Ariana Grande’s relationship with the media outlets and people who “fantasize” i.e. concoct lies from their outside perspective about her life. She knows they use drama to spin a story around, and that they like to play games with her life.

Over an R&B-infused electronic-pop instrumental, Grande talks about playing the part of the villain since she sees right through the intentions of the media and those who gossip about her have, saying she’ll “be good in it too”. Throughout 2023, there were numerous rumors and gossip about Grande’s relationships and her personal life. From her divorce with Dalton Gomez, to her new relationship with Ethan Slater, and even discussions surrounding her body.

A few demos of the track leaked on June 30, 2023. Grande expressed her emotions on the leaks, saying:

https://filepicker-images.genius.com/SzUUQc1GR3yKqyIHp6Tm_arianas-comment-on-a-now-deleted-tiktok-featuring-her-v0-wqy10r8pgcob1.webp

While talking to Zach Sang in February 2024, Grande explained that she “took notes” on the songs that were leaked which she was planning to revisit, and said “they’re completely different now”. The track also ties into the following track on the tracklist, “the boy is mine”, and during an interview with Zane Lowe in March 2024, Grande said:

It’s an untrue story, based on all untrue events. It sets up “the boy is mine” obviously. It’s kind of like, “Okay, I’ll play the bad girl. Now here’s your bad girl anthem.” That’s why they’re in that order on the tracklist.

embed_content: Read “true story” by Ariana Grande on Genius
recording_location: Jungle Studios (New York, NY), MXM Studios (Stockholm, SE) and Decoy Studios (Suffolk, UK)

album.full_title: eternal sunshine deluxe: brighter days ahead (instrumental version) by Ariana Grande
album.name: eternal sunshine deluxe: brighter days ahead (instrumental version)
